registers.name: BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Core Clock Default value is 48MHz

bitfields.name: AGDET_RE_EN
bitfields.description: Enablement and arming of security detectors (LVD, HVD, AGDET)

bitfields.name: HEADER
bitfields.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. If the CMPA header marker is 16'hFFFF and the device is in the Develop lifecycle state, the main flash permission is R/W/X. When the CMPA header marker is valid, the permissions of the sectors of the main flash will depend on the values written for the flash access control. The flash access control values start at offset 0x40 in the CMPA

registers.name: FLASH_CFG
registers.description: Flash Configuration

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description: Flash remap size. This field should be written to remap field in flash

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command

registers.name: BOOT_LED_STATUS
registers.description: Boot LED Status

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on fatal errors during boot. ROM toggles the GPIO pin identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. Note, use QUICK_SET_/CLR_GPIOx field to set the default level of pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

registers.name: BOOT_TIMERS
registers.description: Boot Timers

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: Powerdown timeout: Timeout value in seconds. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM uses it as idle timeout value to enter power-down state to conserve power

registers.name: ISP_UART_CFG
registers.description: ISP UART Configuration

bitfields.name: UART_RX_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default UART RX ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as UART_RX pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: UART_RX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: UART_ISP_INSTANCE
bitfields.description: Identifies the LPUART instance used for UART ISP mode

bitfields.name: UART_TX_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default UART TX ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as UART_TX pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: UART_TX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: UART_BAUD_RATE
bitfields.description: UART baud rate.Baud rate configured during UART ISP mode

registers.name: ISP_I2C_CFG
registers.description: ISP I2C Configuration

bitfields.name: I2C_SCL_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default I2C SCL ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SCL pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: I2C_SCL_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: I2C_ISP_INSTANCE
bitfields.description: Identifies the LPI2C instance used for I2C ISP mode

bitfields.name: I2C_SDA_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default I2C SDA ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SDA pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: I2C_SDA_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

registers.name: Reserved 0x00018
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: ISP_SPI_CFG0
registers.description: ISP SPI Configuration 0

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI SCK ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: SPI_ISP_INSTANCE
bitfields.description: Identifies the LPSPI instance used for SPI ISP mode

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI MOSI ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

registers.name: ISP_SPI_CFG1
registers.description: ISP SPI Configuration 1

bitfields.name: SPI_MISO_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI MISO ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: SPI_SSEL_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI SSEL ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SSEL pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_SSEL_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_SSEL_X
bitfields.description: SPI chip select number. FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects

registers.name: Reserved 0x00024
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00028
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: ISP_MISC_CFG
registers.description: ISP MISC Configuration

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
registers.description: Quick Set to Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
registers.description: Quick Clear to Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_1
registers.description: Quick Set to Drive GPIO 1 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 1. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1
registers.description: Quick Clear to Drive GPIO 1 port [31:0] pins low after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 1. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_2
registers.description: Quick Set to Drive GPIO 2 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 2. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_2
registers.description: Quick Clear to Drive GPIO 2 port [31:0] pins low after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 2. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: Reserved 0x00078
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x0007C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00080
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00084
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00088
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x0008C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: ROP_STATE
registers.description: Read Out Protection (ROP) State value. Device does not support secure boot, but it does support four levels of Read Out Protection, referred as ROP_STATE. This read out protection is a mechanism that allows user to enable different levels of protection in the system. ROM reads ROP_STATE from ROP_STATE and ROP_STATE_DP on IFR0, does the compare, and if it does not match, resets the device; if match then programs it to SYSCON->ROP_STATE. Any other value then four listed means ROP3-like behavior (debug disabled/locked, ISP disabled).

bitfields.name: ROP_STATE
bitfields.description: ROP_STATE[31:0]

values.name: ROP_LEVEL0
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xFFFF_FFFF (erased FLASH value), no ROP. Default for blank state

values.name: ROP_LEVEL1
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xEEBA_04C3. Debug disabled and unlocked, can be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available

values.name: ROP_LEVEL2
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0x4939_8D8B. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available

values.name: ROP_LEVEL3
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xB0AB_B703. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, no debug mailbox commands available

registers.name: SBL_PROT
registers.description: Secondary Boot Loader Protection.If the field contains a value other than 0x0000_0000 or 0xFFFF_FFFF, Debug Mailbox commands and ISP commands will not be allowed at In-Field ROP1 and In-Field life cycles.

registers.name: SBL_START_ADDR
registers.description: Secondary Boot Loader Start Address.At the end of boot ROM execution, if the user does not wish boot ROM to jump at address 0x0000_0000 (default jump address) of the main flash, this field needs to be programmed with a valid flash jump address.

registers.name: Reserved 0x0009C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: ROP_STATE_DP
registers.description: Read Out Protection (ROP) State duplicate value. ROM reads ROP_STATE from ROP_STATE and ROP_STATE_DP on IFR0, does the compare, and if it does not match, resets the device; if match then programs it to SYSCON->ROP_STATE. Any other value then four listed means ROP3-like behavior (debug disabled/locked, ISP disabled). Duplicate of ROP_STATE at offset 0x90

bitfields.name: ROP_STATE_DP
bitfields.description: ROP_STATE_DP[31:0]

values.name: ROP_LEVEL0
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xFFFF_FFFF (erased FLASH value), no ROP. Default for blank state

values.name: ROP_LEVEL1
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xEEBA_04C3. Debug disabled and unlocked, can be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available

values.name: ROP_LEVEL2
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0x4939_8D8B. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available

values.name: ROP_LEVEL3
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xB0AB_B703. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, no debug mailbox commands available

registers.name: SBL_PROT_DP
registers.description: Secondary Boot Loader Protection (Duplicate). Duplicate of SBL_PROT at offset 0x94

registers.name: SBL_START_ADDR_DP
registers.description: Duplicate of SBL_START_ADDR at offset 0xA0

registers.name: Reserved 0x000AC
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: SI_ERASE_TOKEN0
registers.description: Secure Installer Erase Token [0:31]. Very important: This field is used by boot ROM when the secure installer is erased. Corrupting this field will lead to the region of the flash where the secure installer is located being non-writable and non-readable.

registers.name: SI_ERASE_TOKEN1
registers.description: Secure Installer Erase Token [32:63]. Very important: This field is used by boot ROM when the secure installer is erased. Corrupting this field will lead to the region of the flash where the secure installer is located being non-writable and non-readable.

registers.name: SI_ERASE_TOKEN2
registers.description: Secure Installer Erase Token [64:95]. Very important: This field is used by boot ROM when the secure installer is erased. Corrupting this field will lead to the region of the flash where the secure installer is located being non-writable and non-readable.

registers.name: SI_ERASE_TOKEN3
registers.description: Secure Installer Erase Token [96:127]. Very important: This field is used by boot ROM when the secure installer is erased. Corrupting this field will lead to the region of the flash where the secure installer is located being non-writable and non-readable.

registers.name: SI_DELETE_TOKEN
registers.description: Secure Installer Delete Token. Token provided by NXP to indicate the desire for the user to erase the secure installer in order to reclaim the flash portion occupied by the secure installer.

registers.name: Reserved 0x000E4
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use
